entry.title: Qt Upper Computer Serial Port
entry.content:
Serial Port

Recently, I’ve been learning how to develop an upper computer using Qt. Along the way, I’ve encountered numerous peculiar challenges and learned a great deal. I’ve decided to document these issues and their solutions in a series of articles. This serves as both a personal record for myself and as inspiration for others who may encounter similar hurdles.

Project Create and UI

Build a new Widget project in Qt creator()

Qt Widgets Applicaiton
-> project name(Qtsp)
-> build system choose “qmake”
-> base class let’s use a simple one “QWidget”
-> keep next…

Open the project we could see there is a file called widget.ui, which is very easy for use to use that to create a simple ui. (Of course we could write code in widget.cpp to create what we need, but this guide is for the beginner, so that is very easy)

Here is the widget I created, include:
Combobox,
Label,
PushButto,
LineEdit,
PlainTextEdit.
